summary: This document is an email chain from October 2021 between a DOJ OIG investigator and a Communication Technician at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It concerns an investigation into a DVR system failure on July 29, 2019, at the MCC, with the technician providing a work order and details about replacing hard drives. The context suggests this is part of an inquiry into surveillance system issues around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.

connections.description: The DOJ OIG investigator is interviewing Mr. M, the Communication Technician, regarding his work on the MCC camera system and the DVR failure in July 2019.

events.title: DVR 2 System Failure at MCC
events.description: A failure of the DVR 2 camera recording system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The Communication Technician (Mr. M) was working on the system around this date, which investigators believe likely caused the failure.

events.title: MCC Camera System Issues and Hard Drive Replacement
events.description: Ongoing issues with the MCC camera system, described as being at 'end of life' with bad hard drives. Mr. M obtained second-hand hard drives and replaced them, working with SigNet on the installation.

keyFacts: A DVR system failure occurred at the MCC New York on July 29, 2019, which is under investigation by the DOJ OIG.
The Communication Technician replaced two hard drives in the system in July 2019 using old drives on hand, with no receipt for new parts.
The technician stated the broader camera system problem in August 2019 was due to bad hard drives and equipment at 'end of life,' requiring second-hand parts.
The DOJ OIG was seeking detailed information about work orders, communications, and the specific actions taken on the surveillance system around the time of the failure.
The context of the inquiry (surveillance failure at the MCC in mid-2019) is directly relevant to the period of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death in August 2019.
